intro: Malouetia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian malouetia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
